required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of PD1-lymphocytes in Bronchoalveolar Lavage of Patients With Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of PD1-lymphocytes in Bronchoalveolar Lavage of Patients With Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this trial is to assess PD1-lymphocytes in bronchoalveolar lavage in patients with lung cancer, ILD and asthma.

detailed_description.textblock: In this trial, 20 patients with lung cancer, 10 patients with asthma and 10 patients with interstitial lung disease who have to undergo bronchocospy for medical reasons are enrolled. In each patient, bronchoalveolar lavage is performed to assess PD1-lymphocytes.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess and compare PD1-lmyphocytes in bronchoalveolar lavage in patients with malignant and benign lung diseases to evluate their impact in lung cancer patients

arm_group.description: In lung cancer patients with indication for bronchoscopy, bronchoalveolar lavage is performed to assess PD1-lymphocytes.
In patients with interstitial lung disease with indication for bronchoscopy, bronchoalveolar lavage is performed to assess PD1-lymphocytes.
In patients with asthma with indication for bronchoscopy, bronchoalveolar lavage is performed to assess PD1-lymphocytes.

intervention.description: Bronchoalveolar lavage is performed by instillation and suction of saline in the middle lobe during bronchoscopy. Cytological examination and flow cytometry will be performed to assess PD-1lymphoctes.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with suspected or proven lung cancer, asthma or instertitial lung disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age >18 years
- patients with lung cancer, asthma or ILD and indication for bronchoscopy for medical reasons
- Ability to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- acute excacerbation in patients with asthma or ILD
- endoluminal tumor growth or penumonia in patients with lung cancer
